intro: Cordyla somalensis, commonly known as the Somali cordyla, is a shrub native to the Horn of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody stem and alternate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous seeds. Cordyla somalensis is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
